experience_programming_general: I have written programs for my own use that are a couple of pages long.
experience_programming_r: I have written and maintained larger pieces of software.
programming_confidence: I could do it quickly with no use of external help.
experience_git: I have used Git regularly for my own projects, including branching and resolving conflicts.
experience_github: I have used GitHub regularly to manage my own repositories (e.g., pushing code, managing issues, using README files).
data_storage_format: In machine readible files (e.g. CSV, JSON)
document_writing_approach: I use literate programming notebooks (e.g., R Markdown, Quarto, Jupyter) to fully integrate code, output, and narrative text in a single document.
experience_ides: I regularly use an IDE for my own projects, taking advantage of features like code completion, debugging, or version control integration.
ides_used: RStudio, Positron, Visual Studio Code (VS Code), Sublime Text
cli_usage: I have used the CLI occasionally for basic tasks (e.g., navigating folders, running simple commands).
llm_usage: I rely on LLMs for completing a wide range of tasks (e.g. several times a day).
llm_tools_used: ChatGPT (OpenAI), Claude (Anthropic), Claude Code (Anthropic), NotebookLM (Google), Copilot for IDEs (GitHub Copilot, Copilot in Visual Studio Code, JetBrains, etc.), Perplexity AI, Mistral AI (including Le Chat), Notion AI, Zoom AI Companion
